trans-unit.source: DSC for Linux nxService Resource
trans-unit.target: DSC for Linux nxService Resource

trans-unit.source: The nxService resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage services on a Linux node.
trans-unit.target: The nxService resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage services on a Linux node.

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: The name of the service/daemon to configure.
trans-unit.target: The name of the service/daemon to configure.

trans-unit.source: Controller
trans-unit.target: Controller

trans-unit.source: The type of service controller to use when configuring the service.
trans-unit.target: The type of service controller to use when configuring the service.

trans-unit.source: Enabled
trans-unit.target: Enabled

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the service starts on boot.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the service starts on boot.

trans-unit.source: State
trans-unit.target: State

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the service is running.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the service is running.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to "Stopped" to ensure that the service is not running.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to "Stopped" to ensure that the service is not running.

trans-unit.source: Set it to "Running" to ensure that the service is not running.
trans-unit.target: Set it to "Running" to ensure that the service is not running.

trans-unit.source: DependsOn
trans-unit.target: DependsOn

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is ResourceName and its type is ResourceType, the syntax for using this property is DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName".
trans-unit.target: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is ResourceName and its type is ResourceType, the syntax for using this property is DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName".

trans-unit.source: Additional Information
trans-unit.target: Additional Information

trans-unit.source: The nxService resource will not create a service definition or script for the service if it does not exist.
trans-unit.target: The nxService resource will not create a service definition or script for the service if it does not exist.

trans-unit.source: You can use the PowerShell Desired State Configuration nxFile Resource resource to manage the existence or contents of the service definition file or script.
trans-unit.target: You can use the PowerShell Desired State Configuration nxFile Resource resource to manage the existence or contents of the service definition file or script.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following example shows configuration of the “httpd” service (for Apache HTTP Server), registered with the SystemD service controller.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows configuration of the “httpd” service (for Apache HTTP Server), registered with the SystemD service controller.
